scenes.heading: EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Margot, in a restaurant polo, ROLLER BLADES to work, taking up much of the road. A line of cars behind her HONKS. She waves them off.

scenes.heading: EXT. STRIP MALL - STARBUCKS - LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Gary’s truck parked off to the side, the Camry still on it. Margot ROLLS past and exits the frame. After a beat... Margot ROLLS BACK INTO THE FRAME. She pats her pocket, pulls out her keychain, the FOB still attached. She presses the fob, hears the DOUBLE BEEP. She thinks for a long moment, then, gl

scenes.heading: INT. STARBUCKS - SAME

dialogues.text: Gimme one of the banana breads. Actually, wait. Lemon loaf. No, wait...

scenes.actionPreview: Gary steps to the front to order. 4. 5. In the b.g. Margot opens the truck door and crawls in.

scenes.heading: EXT. TOW TRUCK - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Margot randomly presses different buttons and levers.

scenes.heading: INT. STARBUCKS - SAME

dialogues.text: Yeah, let’s go with the banana bread.

scenes.actionPreview: Gary stares at the pastries as the barista waits, impatiently. In the b.g., the flatbed begins lowering.

scenes.heading: EXT. TOW TRUCK - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Margot now frantically removing the pins from the wheels. She slips inside the Camry.

scenes.heading: INT. CAMRY - CONTINUOUS
scenes.actionPreview: Margot starts the engine. Music BLASTS. She turns it down, then shifts in reverse, and... nothing. She SLAMS the gas.

scenes.heading: INT. STARBUCKS - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: As the barista hands Gary a croissant, we HEAR a loud SCREECH. Gary turns to see -- A PLUME OF SMOKE RISING from the tires spinning in place as the Camry strains to break free from the under hook.

scenes.heading: I/E. CAMRY - SAME

dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!
Trying to save my house, Gary!
You know what, just tow it.

scenes.actionPreview: A small crowd has gathered to watch this mechanical tug of war. Phones are raised, recording. Gary BOLTS out. 5. 6. He gets to the truck and hits a lever. The Camry immediately goes perpendicular, hanging like a captured shark, with only its front tires on the ground. Margot turns the wheel and SLAM

scenes.heading: EXT. COURT HOUSE STEPS - DAY

dialogues.text: I don’t know. I just reacted.
One more infraction and you lose your license.
Lotta good a license does when I don’t have a car.
My mom left me that house. It’s paid off. Can they do this?
If you haven’t paid your taxes they can. Good news is you have until

scenes.actionPreview: Margot, rollerblades slung over her shoulder, exits with her PUBLIC DEFENDER, 50s, rumpled suit, ponytail. She hands him the court order, he scans it as she takes off her shoes and changes into her rollerblades. September first. That’s all summer. You’ll pay it off. Margot rollerblades away. 6. 7.

scenes.heading: INT. LOBSTER CLAW - DAY

dialogues.text: Why don’t you go wait in your boat and I’ll sound the foghorn when we’re open.
What the hell is your problem?
Hey, hey! C’mon, Margot. Sir, I can make that drink for you.
I’ve tried. She won’t leave, Sir.
You can’t start the season like this. I don’t love these people either, but they keep the lights on. Summer’s when we make all our money. You know this.

scenes.actionPreview: An open-air restaurant/bar on the beach. Margot cuts lemons as she preps the bar. A WALL STREET type, 50’s, sunburnt, enters talking loudly on his phone. Margot clocks him, goes back to cutting lemons. Yeah the new place is right on the water, you gotta come out. As he comes up to the bar, he shouts

scenes.heading: INT. LOBSTER CLAW - LATER

dialogues.text: This car’s only a thousand. No that’s just for tires.
Great. I can’t even afford tires.
We’ve looked everywhere, we’re not gonna find anything. (MORE)
You could sell your kidney. REVEAL Sara’s husband, HENRY, 35, in a charter boat jacket, sits behind them, whittling. He has a beer in front of him.
Or your hair, your eggs, your plasma. Our bodies are cash cows.
I’m trying to help. I’m a solutions orientated person. (to Margot)
No. I can’t stand the thought of these rich fucks living in my house.

(takes it, reads screen) “Free Buick. This is going to sound strange, but our son is starting college in the fall and we want to help him. He’s a wonderful young man, extremely smart but socially very shy.
This has to be a joke, right?
Have you seen these helicopter parents? They do everything for their kids. This is just the next logical step.
You guys aren’t serious? Margot won’t even rent out her house so why would she rent out her... y’know?
What? Oh, because I’m a man I can’t express an opinion on this?
Yeah, and you have a Roadrunner tattoo covering your entire back.
(shrugs) I have sex with random guys all the time. I’d love if they gave me a
Babe, you don’t know this, but women have sex for reasons you can’t even imagine. Do you know how much “just get it over with sex” I’ve had with you?
I had sex once to get out of playing
I had sex once because I didn’t want to commute the next day.
I had sex once because I wanted to go to New Hampshire.
I had sex once on a first date because I thought the guy was gonna kill me.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot folds napkins. Her co-worker and friend, SARA (30s, extremely pregnant) scrolls Craigslist on her phone. 8. 9. (then) And I’m losing hundreds of dollars every day I’m not driving. People don’t understand that. I read about a guy in Cambodia who sold his feet. Henry. I can feel our children ge

scenes.heading: I/E. OLD CARGO VAN - NIGHT

dialogues.text: I just know my mom would’ve wanted me to fight to keep this house.
I say you do what you need to do.
Hey, it would be the fastest way to get a car.
Yeah, he’ll cream his shorts as soon as he sees you. Then you can drive right home haha.
No, because he’s eighteen, not because Margot’s so hot.
Thanks for the ride. (inside joke) I love you, Gus.

scenes.actionPreview: Sara pulls up to Margot’s house, takes Margot’s hand. Henry’s in the back seat. Sara glares at her husband. Another glare. Henry sighs, gives up. Margot exits the van. Henry unbuckles to move up front.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT’S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Margot, exhausted, opens her front gate. It SQUEAKS. She opens it closes it several times. LATER Margot, pen flashlight in her mouth, fixes the hinge. She swings the gate to test it. Satisfied, she goes inside. 12. 13.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S HOUSE -- KITCHEN - LATER
scenes.actionPreview: The house is furnished with little money but lots of care. Photos of Margot and her mother throughout the years. Margot cooks some rice, goes through her mail -- mostly bills with "PAST DUE" stamped on them. LATER Margot eats a simple dinner alone at her kitchen table.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT’S HOUSE - MORNING
scenes.actionPreview: Various shots. - Margot has her tools out, replaces a doorknob. - Margot carefully repaints a window frame. - Margot prunes carnations from her garden. - Margot mows her lawn, stops the lawnmower and takes in the house, thinks...

scenes.heading: EXT. MODERN BEACH HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot roller blades up to the end of the driveway. She looks up at the steep incline to the gate, sighs.

scenes.heading: EXT. DRIVEWAY - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Margot struggles up the driveway, going more sideways than up. The LANDSCAPERS watch dispassionately. Margot grabs hold of a branch for support. She turns to see: The garage is open and inside is -- a 2013 emerald green BUICK REGAL. Margot stares at her life raft. The branch SNAPS and she begins rol

scenes.heading: EXT. FRONT GATES - LATER

dialogues.text: Thank you so much for coming. This is my partner, Laird.
Allison and Laird lead Margot down a corridor with floor to ceiling windows. Tasteful sculptures and modern art. The faint sound of NPR can be heard.
A spectacular view of the Atlantic. Margot sits in an enormous chair across from Allison and Laird. She dabs at her sweat with a napkin.
She’s like an organizational genius. She’s family.
So, Margot, tell us about yourself.
A local! Well I’m jealous. You get to live in paradise all year long.
I thought I recognized a few of them.
Wow, that is some good cheese.
Feel free to bring some home with you. We’ll have Inez wrap it up.
So, Margot, I meant to ask on the phone: how old are you?
I know you’re looking for someone early to mid twenties. I’m slightly older.
And how old are you right now?
That’s older than we were thinking.

May I be frank? I assume I’m here because you haven’t found anyone yet. And the reason you haven’t found anyone is because young girls are idiots. It’s not their fault, they’re young. But this is your son we’re talking about. What you need is someone who looks like a peer, but is mature enough to handle this with the tact and sensitivity the situation requires.
And normal. It’s been really hard to find someone normal.
We’re just worried about our son.
The only problem is he’s never dated anybody. We’re worried he’s falling behind... socially.
And he’s always on his phone. It makes him anxious and depressed.
Laird was unhappy when he was
And you know what helped him? We started “dating” right before college -- and Laird thrived.
And that’s what we want for Percy.
That. And we know his passcode.
We were hoping he was gay. It would explain things. He’s an introvert.
And we’ve tried everything: Setting him up with girls at school, family friends’ kids. Nothing’s worked.
We’re just really worried about him. We can’t send him off to college like this. We just can’t.
That’s why you called a professional. (immediately)
It’s just what Dad drove. He refused to buy German or Japanese cars.
No, he hated foreigners. He’d shout “they come here and take what’s ours!”
I know the feeling. (then) I’m fine with money, too...
Yeah, thing is, Laird’s a lawyer...
Oh, I’m on the pill. Or do you mean condoms? I’m all stocked up.
Then great! Just date Percy and the
And get to know him. He’s a great kid.
But also date him. Date him hard.
Oh yeah, I see the resemblence.
We couldn’t have children, so Percy’s been a blessing for us.
Oh, and -- I don’t see this happening -- but if Percy meets someone the “organic” way...
What I’m saying is: the deal’s off if you’re beaten to the punch.
Well. I better get to work then.
Oh, no. No, he’s not home.
Yes, he can’t know about this.
He would be destroyed, and it would obviously defeat the purpose of helping his confidence.
Let’s bring up Percy’s summer calendar.
We thought you could go in there like you’re looking to adopt a dog.
That is so sweet. I love dogs. I can’t wait to meet Percy.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot marches up to the gate, her blades in her hands. She’s sweaty and one knee is skinned. She presses the speaker. A moment later the gates part to reveal a modern structure of glass, wood, and steel. Waiting at the front door are ALLISON and LAIRD GLADWELL, a well-tanned, white couple in their

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S BEDROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: A ship-in-a-bottle and an Incredible Hulk figure on his shelf. Daredevil and Green Lantern comics sequentially organized. A framed “Dragon Ball Z” animation cell on beside a poster of Odd Future. A Princeton sweatshirt hangs off a chair. Two pill bottles on his nightstand. In the middle of it all is

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Percy sits at the kitchen table, mindlessly scrolling on his phone. Allison serves him a sandwich, the corners cut off.

scenes.heading: EXT. SAG HARBOR BAY - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Laird pilots the boat while Percy looks at his phone.

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S BEDROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: - Percy plays heavy metal on his electric guitar. He’s okay. - Percy plays a video game. - Percy watches TikTok. Two GIRLS in boxers and t-shirts do a choreographed dance.

scenes.heading: EXT. COUNTRY ROAD - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Percy, in a helmet and neon vest, cautiously bikes along the fog line, wincing as a car whooshes past.

scenes.heading: EXT. BEST FRIENDS - PARKING LOT - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Percy locks up his bike, heads inside. Beat. He quickly doubles back to make sure that his bike is locked, giving the bike lock numbers another cautionary scramble.

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - EARLY EVENING

dialogues.text: Hi, can I interest you in some unconditional love? Looking for something to slobber on you?
He mostly works with the dogs. I deal with people.
You have a weird energy. I want him.
Percy! Can you help this lady?
How can I help you, ma’am?
It’s not a cartoon. It’s anime.
Yeah, animated. That’s what I said. (then)
I wish I could save them all. Which is the most fucked up?
This is Milo. He’s really sweet.
Sorry, Milo, I’m fresh out. (clocks Percy’s side eye)
Not sure. I’d need to ask you a few questions first to make sure you’re a suitable candidate.
By all means. If you feel the need to take me in the back and inspect me.
Not you specifically. We have to do it with everyone. It’s the rules.

scenes.actionPreview: An upscale animal shelter. Fancy dog food and toys line the walls. Lots of barking. Margot enters, dressed to impress in a revealing outfit. She spots Percy giving a wiener dog a scalp massage. He notices Margot, quickly looks away. 22. 23. She smiles and starts towards him when a chunky, confident

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - BACK OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I should have a name tag right here.
And why do you want to adopt a dog?
Because I can’t have dogs of my own. (joke dies, quiet)
I won’t. I’ve lived here my whole life. I love it here. I’m not going anywhere.
Well if you’ve never done anything different, how do you know you won’t like something else better?
Sorry. No. I didn’t mean to pry.
Pry. Pry me open. I promise I’ll lay myself bare.
Awwww, but I have more questions.
You can come back another day.
Or I can give you a ride home and we can keep talking?

scenes.actionPreview: Pictures of happy owners and their new dogs hang on the wall. Percy takes a seat at the desk. Margot sits across from him. He pulls up the questionnaire on the laptop. Margot. Chapman. She jiggles her breast. He doesn’t notice. It’s more fun. You can be spontaneous, y’know. Unmarried. (then) Childre

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - MAIN AREA - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: Is it okay if I leave early?

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy breeze past Crispin at reception. You can finish alone, right? Bet you do it all the time. They exit. Crispin is shocked.

scenes.heading: EXT. BEST FRIENDS - PARKING LOT - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: This is your van? ANGLE on the windowless pedophile van.
Actually, I just remembered I rode my bike here.
You can sit up front with me. Get in.
(smiles) I won’t bite. Unless you want me to.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy approach Sara/Henry’s VAN. Percy stops in his tracks. 27. 28. More privacy. Beat. Percy grows uncomfortable. He unlocks his bike. Margot opens the back of the van. She takes it, throws it in the back. He just stands there. He cautiously gets in.

scenes.heading: I/E. VAN - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I mean yeah, whatever, I’ve been with girls a couple times. (singing along ) “Slow Ride, take it eas y.”
Where’s the rest of my seatbelt?
That is a lap belt. Just pretend you’re on an airplane. I’ll be your flight attendant.
Why is the flight attendant flying the plane?
Because I’ve killed the pilot and taken the plane over. You’re my hostage.
Gimme that! You guys and your phones.
You tried abducting me! You put me in a van and took my phone!
If I were kidnapping you, you think I’d give you all my personal information first?
Couldn’t you just use your rape whistle?
Why would I have a rape whistle?
WHY DO YOU HAVE MACE?? (then, polite)
Did you turn the water on?
You have to turn the water on?
Are you fucking with me? Turn the spigot.
That’s the gas meter. Over there.
I don’t know how to work the equipment. We have gardeners.
Percy... I wasn’t trying to abduct you. I just thought you were cute.
Yeah, back when I had retinas.
No, I want to. Just gimme like half an hour to flush out my contacts.
I didn’t mean now. I meant tomorrow.

scenes.actionPreview: Foghat blares on the radio. Percy nervously fiddles with his lapbelt. 28. 29. She takes a hard right turn. This isn’t the way to my house. Percy looks in the back of the van: Harpoons, ropes, cages. Might as well be torture equipment. Percy tenses, then covertly takes his phone out, begins texting “

scenes.heading: EXT. LOBSTER CLAW - PARKING LOT - NIGHT

dialogues.text: I can’t believe this kid is going to Princeton. He’s dumb as shit.
He’s not dumb, he’s just scared of the world. They’re all like this.
My cousin, she’s nineteen and still lives at home. Doesn’t drive, doesn’t go to parties. Always on her phone.
Well, I need the van again tomorrow.
It’s gonna take a week to air this thing out and Sara’s pregnant, she can’t be breathing these fumes.
A DODGE NEON wrapped in vinyl “Lobster Claw” marketing.
(conspiratorial) Y’know, you could do what Melanie’s doing and get a sugar daddy. You won’t need to worry about a car. Or property taxes.

The whole point of this Buick thing is that it’s quick. (off Melanie) I’m not gonna be on call to some rich asshole all summer. So if you see me doing that, it means I’ve compromised who I am and you can kill me. Because I’ve given up. (beat)
Honestly, sounds like he was just nervous. A date could be good.
(in her head) I need to be making money. I need that car.
Listen. Go on a date. Get drunk together. He’ll loosen up. It’ll be fun!
Of course. We’ll just get drunk together. Why didn’t I think of that?

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Sara sit on the curb while Henry opens all the doors and windows of the van. Margot holds a wet rag to her eyes. They grow up encased in bubblewrap. You’ve lost van privileges. (points off screen) Ask Fern for the claw car. They stop talking as a pretty local girl, MELANIE, walks by, gets

scenes.heading: EXT. TOWNIE BAR - NIGHT

dialogues.text: I’m so glad we’re doing this. A date was a great idea.
Can I ask you a question?
Am I allowed to be here?
Oh, yeah. I know the owner. It’s fine. (looks around)
Yeah. He put it in writing. I got it notarized and everything. (then, softens)
Yeah, it’s just -- I barely know you, but I’ll just tell you.
And I had a dream about you. It was really intense. Don’t ask.
You ever have one of those?
You know Harley Quinn? From Suicide
I had a dream I wouldn't let her adopt a dog, so she locked me in one of the dog cages and dragged me back to her hideout. Very intense.
What? No! I kicked at the cage and screamed until finally Inez came in my room and woke me up.
You asked if I have intense dreams.
You’re right. I should’ve been more specific.
Alright, here we go. Makers neat.
No, Percy, no. He’ll have a beer.
Oh wait, you guys sell daiquiris?
I’ve always wanted to try one. (then, dramatic)
Oh they have Big Buck Hunter. Cool.
You don’t want an adult beverage?
You’re eighteen. You’re not even curious about drinking?
Manhattan for the lady and a virgin daiquiri for the young man.
It’s time to learn. You’re going to college in the fall. C’mon. Open hatch.
Let me in. Boop. Beep. Bop.
Margot Chapman as I live and breathe. REVEAL a townie in an Islanders shirt. Margot forces a smile.
I thought you died or something cause I suddenly stopped hearing from you.
I don’t know if you heard...
Anyway, your little disappearing act was the best thing that ever happened to me.
Well it sounds like you’re doing great. It was great catching up.
That’s great. Is she easy to clean?
No, she’s a real person. Unlike you.
What part of Russia did they mail her from?
Best of all, when I told her I loved her, she said it back instead of running away like a coward.
That must have been an exciting second date.
Can I ask you a question?
Really? Cause it seems you don’t like him.
I didn’t have sex with him.
Want to? I can call him back over.
I just don’t understand why you’d have sex with someone you don’t like.
Do you need alcohol to have fun?
Some nights I don’t drink at all. I just get super high.
Hmm. Can I ask you a question?
You don’t have to ask me if you can ask me a question every time, dude.
I’m just trying to get to know you.
No. We’re leaving. Pay the bill and meet me outside.

scenes.actionPreview: Pool table, juke box, neon beer signs. Margot finishes a beer. Percy looks out of the place amongst the older crowd. 33. 34. Where’s the waitress? Look, you’re going to college soon, you should get used to being in a bar. Okay. (then) I just hope my parents don’t see that I’m here. Do they come here

scenes.heading: EXT. BEACH - ENTRANCE - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I had a lot to drink in there, I think I’m drunk.
Good. We’ll have it to ourselves.
We could get in trouble. And it’s not even sunny.
This is better. Nobody can see us.
Let’s get you out of these jean shorts.
You’re right, here comes one now.
(tugs) C’mon. I wanna see your pussy.
Guess you’re just not attracted to me. Or maybe you think I’m ugly...
I don’t! (quiet) I think you’re really pretty.
GET THE FUCK IN HERE RIGHT NOW!
Okay, I’m going to trust you.
See? That’s not so bad, right?
I just hope there’s no riptides.
(O.S.) FUCK HER! FUCK HER IN THE BUTT!
THREE PREPPY TEENS (two boys and a girl) watching and whooping and drinking beers.
You said nothing would happen! We need to find an adult.
You think it’s cool to steal clothes?
These jean shorts were a gift!
Percy watches Margot approach with their belongings. She drops them on the sand before returning to the water.
Did you beat up those kids?
I don’t like this. Something’s really wrong with you.
They had our clothes, keys, phones, wallets. I got them back. What would you have done, nothing? You should be thanking me!
(high-pitched) I was coming up with a plan!
A plan to call your parents? (mocking) “Mommy, Daddy, teens stole my denim panties!” (then, sweet) I’m sorry, that was mean. Let’s fuck.
Because you’re scary! It’s like you’re trying to eat me or kill me.
What a waste of time, man. I feel sorry for you. I’m done.
I feel sorry for you. You drive a freaking lobster car.
Hey, at least I’m not scared to drive.
Margot gets to the claw car, throws Percy’s clothes on the passenger seat. She gets in and gets dressed. Percy, naked, runs up to her door, tries it -- it’s locked.
Just check! My parents need to be able to know where I am.
Not until I get my phone.
They pass several people who look on in amazement.
I will drive to fucking Chicago.
Let me off! Let me off!
Going the other way. The COPS clock the bizarre scene of a naked teenager on a lobster car hood.
(thinks, then) I’m on probation, I can’t lose my license!
Percy SCREAMS as the lobster car RACES towards the descending gates. Percy looks back, sees the gates dropping.
What the fuck are you doing!?

scenes.actionPreview: They walk on to the beach. Percy looks around. Yup. After 8. Closed. Yeah, there’s no lifeguards. Margot hooks her fingers in his belt loops, draws Percy closer. Margot gives his shorts a tug. He pulls them up. Yeah, I am. 41. 42. Margot gives up, lets go. Tries another tactic. Sensing an opening, s

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT

dialogues.text: I don’t see any cops out there.
I can’t believe we drove across the train tracks. I thought we were gonna die!
You were really brave, holding onto the hood like that. Most guys would have fallen off. But not you. (downs her drink)
(calls out) I like your house! Cozy.
Thanks! The bedroom’s the best part. I’ll show it to you later.
Okay, okay, you got me. I’m dancing.
Mm hmm. The slower the sexier.
People normally get rashes after they have sex.
This happens sometimes when I get nervous. I’m sorry.
This is for surf board rash, but it should do the trick.
Don’t be. I went as a baby to a
No, they’re not. Diapers are like wearable toilets.
There’s a smile. You should smile more. You have a great smile.
I don’t have a lot to smile about. I’m really fucked up.
Oh you’re the one? I read about you. (then)
I’ve lived in this house my whole life.
You’ve lived in one house in one town?
(smiles) I love it here. People look after each other. There’s a community.
Yeah, I guess that makes sense.
I did leave once. Packed my life into my car and drove across the country to surf every beach in
You drove across the country alone?!
Yeah. I wanted to do something totally new.
Weren’t you scared of getting murdered?
I was eighteen, I didn’t really think about it.
I made this special surfboard. It had a map of every California beach I was going to surf.
Oh, no. I only made it as far as
After all that you turned back?! Why?
My mom got sick. I had to take care of her.
Why couldn’t your dad do it?
Because he was in the city with his family.
How much time do you have?
It’s complicated. Probably why I spend so much time alone. Having
My old nanny. Jean basically raised me. You guys kinda remind me of each other. You guys should meet!
Sorry I couldn’t have sex with you today. I know I’m being a tease.
Maybe we can spend the day together tomorrow? Then I promise I’ll put out.

scenes.actionPreview: Percy, still high from their close call, excitedly peaks through the blinds facing the street. I think we lost them! Margot pulls a candle from a drawer, lights it. Keep looking. We need music. What? Why? Margot exits the room. Percy sits down on the couch, takes a look around the space. Suddenly mu

scenes.actionPreview: Percy and Margot bike/rollerblade with rescue dogs pulling them on leashes.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy play keep-away from the dogs with a tennis ball, throw it back and forth as the pack chases them .

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy shampoo dogs. Crispin watches them laughing together .

scenes.heading: INT. ARCADE - LATER
scenes.actionPreview: - They play skee-ball. Percy hits the center ring. Tickets fly out. - They sit inside a TWO-PLAYER Halo-type fighting game. CLOSE ON Percy’s avatar decapitates Margot’s avatar. POP-A-SHOT Percy shoots. Margot blocks him.

scenes.heading: INT. ARCADE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: They play Dance Dance Revolution together, dancing in sync. TICKET COUNTER - LATER They dump their tickets on the counter and scan their prize choices.

scenes.heading: EXT. ARCADE - LATER

dialogues.text: Alright, I have a prize for both of us. Close your eyes. (she does)
Yeah, you need me to get out, you can’t do it alone. Push in.
Yeah, but you can’t just Chinese finger trap someone. It’s fucked up.
I bet if we went to high school together we’d be friends?
I didn’t have a lot friends. I didn’t go to dances or anything. (then) I bet you were Prom Queen or something.
I didn’t even go to prom.
Everyone asked me. And I had a date and a dress and everything. Just didn’t work out.

I wrote my biological father. I had this fantasy he would read it and then drive over and apologize to my mom and me for leaving us. And then the morning of prom I got the letter returned to me. It was unopened.
Would you ever reach out to your dad?
Pfft. Fuck no. He left, he can reach out.
Sorry if that was too wet.
No, don’t apologize. That was perfect wetness. You’re a great kisser. So do you want to-
My nanny, remember? (Raeding) “Meet at the ice cream stand.”
I don’t have much time before I have to bartend. I thought we could go back to my place.
We have all summer. Come on!

scenes.actionPreview: They sit on a bench. Margot wears a novelty beer helmet with two sodas in it, a STUFFED PANDA at her feet. 56. 57. Percy reaches into his bag of prizes, pulls out a Nerf football, continues digging. And stick out your finger. (she does) Now you’re stuck with me forever. Margot opens her eyes. Looks

scenes.heading: EXT. ICE CREAM STAND - DAY

dialogues.text: So this is the famous Margot. I’ve heard a lot about you.
It was just a couple summers during college when Percy was in middle school. Our parents are friends.
That’s great. How old are you?
He’s so fast. Little motor on that guy.
It’s his parents’ money, not his.
You like little kids or something?
It was a summer job. And men can be nannies.
They can. But they shouldn’t. Cause it’s weird.
Are you even allowed to be here?
Same thing as you. I wanna date him.
I don’t know what you’re doing with him. But if you hurt him, I will hurt you.
I had to wrestle a dog for it, but I got it.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy approach the stand. Percy lights up. An ELDERLY WOMAN turns towards them. She walks right past Margot revealing a MAN in his 30s, athletic, older brother vibes. He points at Percy. 59. 60. Percy and Jean execute an elaborate handshake. He turns to Margot, smiles warmly. Aw, Jean! C’

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY

dialogues.text: Okay, ready? I’m gonna bring it out.
Oh my god, Margot! You made this?
Yeah, figured it might help get them into surfing early.
I think I have batteries somewhere.
Margot snaps to, sees a MAN -- 30, slicked-back hair, pleated slacks, dress shirt and tasseled loafer -- smiling and waving at her back door.
(at a loss) I’m sorry. Have we-- uh--
It’s Doug Hines! We went to high school together.
I ran varsity track? Drove that cherry red Miata? Nothing? (then, reluctant) I had sex with Mrs. Walsh, the
Doug Hines! Yeah, you were on tv.
Mrs. Hines did. Then we got married.
But, ya know, they never run that story. It’s a double standard, too. I’m sure you date older guys.
Hey, have you been hanging out with my wife?!
Anyway, so I’m a realtor now. I don’t have to tell you this is a fabulous neighborhood. A half acre on this street? Name your price.
I have company, but it was good catching up, Doug.
Because if you don’t pay off your lien, the county will fire sale it.
Hasta la vista, Margot! I’ll slide my card under.

scenes.actionPreview: Sara and Henry are sitting on the couch. Margot enters holding a NURSERY MOBILE with a dozen handmade surfboards. Henry examines one of the little surfboards. 62. 63. This one has a shark bite. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER Margot searches through her drawers. Takes out some plastic bins, looks under some

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: The music continues as Percy puts a tuxedo on. He checks himself out in front of a mirror, adjusts his bow time.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT’S BEDROOM - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Margot pulls out an old PROM DRESS, still in its plastic.

scenes.heading: INT. LIMO - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy sit in the back of a stretch limousine. No, I love it. We’re finally going to prom. He pulls a corsage from his inside jacket pocket, puts it around her wrist. She’s touched. She opens her purse, produces a white carnation and pins it on Percy’s lapel. They both sit there. Beat. She

scenes.heading: EXT. BOSTWICK YACHT CLUB - HOSTESS STAND
scenes.actionPreview: Margot waits while Percy checks in with the hostess. She peeks inside, clocks the dimly lit bar area where a mix of moneyed older men and beautiful young women flirt. She eyes them curiously. 65. 66.

scenes.heading: INT. YACHT CLUB RESTAURANT - LATER

dialogues.text: You’re scared of the Meg? A dinosaur shark?
They existed. And we can’t prove they’re extinct.
I haven’t seen you in forever. My parents said you’re going to Princeton?
I’m applying too, for next year!
Oh, sorry, this is Margot. Margot, this is Natalie. Our parents are friends.
Nice to meet you. Are you friends with them too?
What about you? Excited for senior year?
Yeah, but I look at the freshman girls and I feel like...
Like a million years old now.
Well, it was good to see you. I don’t know what you’re doing later but I’m going to a party. There’ll be Princeton people there.
Jeez, I don’t recall ordering a phony bitch before our appetizers.
I think she farted. Do you smell that?
Did you know Princeton’s only three hours from here?
Yeah. It’s an easy trip. I could come back every weekend if I wanted to.
... To see you. Or you could visit me.
Maybe. I don’t really do long distance...
Look, why don’t we just get through prom together first.
You’ll probably get sick of me, anyway.
You don’t know that. Maybe you end up wanting to hang out with someone your own age.
You just said she was a phony bitch.
And you said she was super nice.
(frustrated) I don’t understand what you want.
I want you to relax and have fun tonight.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy are halfway through their dinner. Margot is laughing. They’re having a good time. He looks up to see NATALIE, 17, Asian, friendly and cute. He gets up. They hug awkwardly. Margot clocks a possible rival. How funny would it be if we went there together! Margot gives her best fake smi

scenes.heading: INT. LIMO - LATER

dialogues.text: I don’t want you to be mad at me.
I just want to be realistic.
I need to hang out with people my own age. Like you said.
There’ll be high school kids too.
Let’s just go back to my house.
Do whatever you want. I need a drink.

scenes.actionPreview: Percy and Margot sit across from each other. Yup. 69. 70. The limousine stops. Margot looks out the window. He exits the limo. Margot follows. It’s a bunch of college kids. Percy goes inside. Drink? Margo reluctantly goes in.

scenes.heading: INT. HOUSE PARTY - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: Margot spots Percy pouring himself a stiff drink. She heads over. She picks up the bottle he just poured, examines it.
(annoyed, doubling down) I know! This is my drink.
(pouring beer) I’m just trying to get a beer. At a party. TEEN #1 (to camera)

scenes.actionPreview: It’s mostly TEENAGERS recording each other on their phones. Other kids post videos of what they’ve just filmed. Some partygoers are commenting on posts of the party, while others comment on the comments. In the corner, a few hardcore kids talk to each other without filming it. Margot enters. Glances

scenes.heading: INT. HALLWAY - LATER

dialogues.text: That’s not a nice question to ask a woman. JOCK #2
Here’s a better idea. Why don’t you two climb in a wine barrel and blow each other.
Where the fuck did you come from?
Stop filming me! No comment. JOCK #1
Have you guys seen Percy? ASIAN GIRL #1
What the fuck? How old do you think I am? Actually, don’t answer that. ASIAN GIRL #1
Open the fucking door, Percy! (waits, then)
Does his nanny have the power to ground him?
Percy and Natalie in bed, half naked.
WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON IN HERE?
Percy, did you take something? (slaps him)
Stick your finger down your throat and make yourself throw up.
I can’t do it! Am I gonna die?
Not really. (then) I didn’t know you can’t drink on Advil.
That the homophobe? JOCK #1 (pointing at Margot)
You think our son would have a party without our consent?
Fine, I don’t care. I’m sorry.
Now get out. You don’t belong here.
Step back. Step away from me.

scenes.actionPreview: Margots wanders the party looking for Percy. She passes two beefy JOCKS in matching “Rye Country Day Wrestling” shirts. One taps her on the shoulder. JOCK #1 Hey, how old are you? Margot stops, turns. No disrespect. He loves cougars. It’s all good. I fuck with big cats. And I heard wine tastes sweet

scenes.heading: INT. LIMO - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I just want you to know I would never hurt you.
I have a condom in my purse.
Shit. I left it at the restaurant.
It’s okay. I bought a value pack.
I can’t find where to tear it.
You don’t have to say it back.
I don’t think we should do this when you’re drunk. Not for your first time.
I think we should we wait.

scenes.actionPreview: They sit across from each other. She has a cold beer pressed up against her throat. Percy sniffles. Stop crying. I’m fine. She cracks open the beer, takes a gulp. Just had to wet the whistle. Percy gets up and sits beside her. He kisses her. It quickly escalates. Clothes start coming off. She looks

scenes.heading: EXT. BOSTWICK YACHT CLUB - DAY

dialogues.text: Hi, I left my purse here last night.
Yes, you were dining with the younger gentleman. I think I saw it in the back. One moment.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot rollerblades up to the hostess stand. An OLDER HOST looks her over. Margot looks over at the bar to see Melanie (of the sugar baby BMW) with a HANDSOME OLDER MAN. Margot just stares, her face a mix of emotions. Here’s your purse. Ma’am? Oh. Thank you. She looks back. Melanie catches her gaze.

scenes.heading: INT. ALLISON AND LAIRD’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY

dialogues.text: Well look what the cat dragged in,
Actually yeah. Really fun. (checks his watch)
You had a big night. Maybe went to a party?
My son, the driver. That’s great.
Yeah. If I have a car, it’ll be easier to see my girlfriend more.
Margot, yeah. She’s older, but she’s really fun. And she doesn’t want to do long distance so I’m not going to Princeton either.
I don’t know, Margot’s here, my work is here, Montauk has everything I need. It’s paradise.
Here’s a solution: I go to
What do you think it was? He’s obviously in love with her!

scenes.actionPreview: Percy shuffles in, hungover but happy. Allison and Laird exchange a look. He sits down, butters some toast. Allison? Allison smugly whisks her matcha. Shoot. I’m gonna be late for work. 80. 81. I was thinking about getting my license. I could use the practice. Beat. Allison and Laird exchange a look

scenes.heading: INT. GARAGE - TESLA - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Percy sits in the driver’s seat of his parent’s Tesla Model X. He tries out the controls, pretends to put an arm around an imaginary Margot. You relax. I’ll drive. Also, I’m getting into surfing. Percy makes engine sounds as he pretends to steer.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - SAME

dialogues.text: She put this idea in his head. You know why? She’s angling for the
You’re gonna yell at the only person Percy will listen to?

scenes.actionPreview: Allison paces. Laird also paces. They’re both pacing in circles, but different circles. Tesla. Call her right now. I’m gonna yell at her. We need her on our side. He’s not going to listen to us. He needs to hear it from her.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT’S HOUSE

dialogues.text: I was about to call you. Listen, Percy has gotten too attached and I can’t do this any--
Forget about that deal. The car is yours.
You’ve gotten him out of his shell, he’s going to parties. He’s confident. It’s all we wanted.
You just have to convince him to go to Princeton.
I have the title and transfer in my office. We’ll sign it over to you today.

scenes.actionPreview: - DAY Margot lies on her bed, staring at the ceiling. Her phone buzzes. It’s Allison. Margot snaps out of her daze, answers. 82. 83. INTERCUT W/ALLISON AND LAIRD Margot sits up, surprised. A look of guilt washes over Margot. Margot exhales. Finally. GARAGE - TESLA - SAME Percy checks out the control

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Margot cuts out on the call. 83. 84. GARAGE - TESLA - SAME The car’s bluetooth syncs. Margot’s voice pipes in to the cabin. And everything you said about Percy is true. He’s become a friend. (waits, get nothing) Hello? Percy quickly turns off the car, in shock.

scenes.heading: INT. GARAGE - TESLA - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Percy sits in the car, gutted. He gets out of the Tesla and goes back inside.

scenes.heading: INT. KITCHEN - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Percy enters, sees Allison’s phone on the counter. Unable to resist, he quickly puts in her code and scrolls through the text messages. His face falls as he reads.

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - DAY

dialogues.text: I got news for you, Percy. There’s only one good female in this world. (to dog, baby talk)
She never liked me. She was just using me.
Your problem is that you’re too nice.
Yeah! Chicks dig an asshole. She walked all over you. I mean she was eye-fucking me that day you guys were shampooing dogs. (points to himself)
It’s Margot. She wants to see me tonight. I don’t know what to do.
Well you’ve come to the right person. As you know from our conversations, I’ve been with a plethora of women so I understand the mindset. (then)
It’s very simple. She broke your heart. You break--
The car. That’s what she cares about. I’m playing 3D chess, keep up. Nothing crazy. Break the antenna off. Crack a headlight.

scenes.actionPreview: Percy lies on the floor, despondent. Crispin grooms an Afghan Hound, a cigarette dangling from his lips. And it’s you, Missy. Isn’t it? Isn’t it? Shu hsu hsu hsushu The dog licks Crispin’s face. He loves it. 84. 85. Asshole. Percy’s phone buzzes. He checks it. Does she have the car yet? Off Percy, a

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S ROOM - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Percy locks his door, pulls out a bottle of vermouth, pours it a coffee mug. He takes a swig, winces. 85. 86.

scenes.heading: INT. DINING ROOM - LATER

dialogues.text: I think that would be fine. You’re a young man now.
Laird opens the front door to find a surprised Margot. A moment of terror passes between them.

scenes.actionPreview: Percy and his parents are having dinner. It’s quiet. Percy fidgets at the table. Allison exchanges a look with Laird. He fills his glass to the brim, gulps it down. The doorbell RINGS. Percy pops into frame with giant glass of wine. Did I double book?

scenes.heading: INT. DINING ROOM - LATER

dialogues.text: Mom, Dad, aren’t you going to ask
Yeah, thanks Champ. So, Margot, where are you from originally?
Mom, you didn’t make it. Inez did.
The food is conflict free, but the dinner isn’t. Mom, maybe we can throw the leftovers under the stairs for Inez?
Well, the important thing is that it’s delicious.
I think the important thing is the truth.
Speaking of which, I didn’t actually get the dates wrong. I wanted Margot here tonight. The truth is I wanted to introduce everyone, but I didn’t know how to explain how old you are to my parents.
Well, I’m not that old. I know a guy who married our high school
Well I hope he got an “A.”
Mom, Dad, aren’t you going to ask us how we met?
Margot, you want to tell them?
But I rejected her application because she was totally unqualified, but we still hit it off. In fact, I had to mace her to get her away from me and even that wouldn’t stop her! She was so horny haha.
It’s Crispin. I have to take this.

scenes.actionPreview: They eat in tense silence. Margot about herself? 86. 87. See this stone work? All local stones. Laird and Allison fake laugh. Percy watches them like a hawk. They go back to eating in silence. Margot, Allison and Laird shift uncomfortably. Beat. They all laugh nervously, relieved. 87. 88. Spanish te

scenes.heading: EXT. DRIVEWAY - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: We’re in the middle of dinner so we need to be fast.
Let’s start with the side mirror.

scenes.actionPreview: Crispin straddling a ten-speed. He’s in a camo shirt and shorts. As Percy walks up, he raises a duffle bag. 88. 89. Okay, let’s put her in neutral and roll her out. GARAGE - MOMENTS LATER Percy and Garett roll the Buick out. Percy looks back at the house, nervously.

scenes.heading: INT. DINING ROOM - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: Have you talked to him about

scenes.actionPreview: Allison, Laird and Margot stare at each other nervously. Princeton yet? 89. (MORE) 90.

scenes.heading: EXT. GARAGE - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: I’m way stronger. If I can’t do it, it can’t be done.
No idea. We can cut every wire.
Not as dangerous as playing with a man’s heart. (MORE)
Maybe this is a bad idea.
Percy is motionless for a beat. Then a look of bewilderment comes over his face. He shoots a puzzled look to Crispin.
The Buick lies on the beach, upside down, one hundred feet below. A smoldering heap of metal.
They stand there in shock. Crispin turns to Percy.

scenes.actionPreview: Crispin pushes his weight on to the side mirror, trying to break it off. No luck. Percy kicks the mirror. Crispin joins in. Nothing. Crispin pulls out a CROWBAR. He walks around the car, popping the hubcaps off. He examines his handiwork. not having hubcaps. MOMENTS LATER The CAR HOOD is up. Percy a

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S HOUSE - DINING ROOM -

dialogues.text: (catching his breath) I think I’m going to go lie down.
(to Laird and Allison) I’ll go talk to him.
Make sure to bring up Princeton.

scenes.actionPreview: MOMENTS LATER Percy shuffles in, dazed. Percy doesn’t even answer, just grabs the wine bottle and starts filling his glass. Percy gives his dad a “thumbs up”, fills the glass to the brim, then downs the entire glass. He gets up and walks out in a daze. Moments later, we hear the muffled roar of guit

scenes.heading: INT. BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I’m addicted to this shit now. The dry kind’s good too.
Percy, I’m trying to talk to you.
Sorry. I care about you, Percy. But I don’t think we should do this.
Since when? Because you hit on me.
If there’s something I don’t know, tell me. But if you want me to believe you actually care about me like you say you do...
Whoa. Slow down, cowboy. Let me help you in the saddle.
Percy, wait, you’re just stabbing my hip bone.
Percy.... that was my thigh gap.
By the way, your car’s on the beach. Crispin and I sent it over the cliff.
Yeah. Sorry, but that’s the price of deception. That’s what Crispin said.
It’s just like every single other thing in my life -- planned by my parents. (then) I had some kind of stupid idea that you liked me. That we were friends.
We are friends. No, that’s the thing -- this is real.
I’m too nice. I am. I put too much faith in people. I think the truth is you can’t trust anybody.
I don’t mean that in a bad way. Not like everyone is untrustworthy or something. Just like, don’t expect anything. Don’t expect anything and then you won’t be disappointed.
It wasn’t personal. I was just trying to save my house.
Thanks. You should go. (unable to help himself)
How much money do your parents have?
Why don’t you ask them? I know you guys are close.
But he’s rich, right? You don’t have to worry about money?
And that makes my life amazing. I have no problems.
I owe forty six thousand dollars in property taxes because people like your parents keep moving here. And I don’t have a rich dad to help me.
Well, you do. He just doesn’t want anything to do with you. And I don’t blame him.
Wait. I didn’t meant that. Margot, I’m sorry! Wait.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot knocks, enters. Percy kicks out a metal guitar riff, fast, precise, punishing... 92. 93. He starts playing even faster. She unplugs the amp. She sits on the edge of his bed. He puts the guitar down, takes a shot of vermouth. He sits beside Margot and immediately tries to kiss her. Percy stand

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S BEDROOM - MORNING
scenes.actionPreview: Margot awakes to the sound of BEEPING.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do with a car that doesn’t run?
Those things are built to last. (still hurt)

scenes.actionPreview: Margot opens her front door to find Gary unloading the busted up Buick in Margot’s driveway. The side mirror is hanging by the wiring. The hubcaps are gone. A huge spidercrack runs across the windshield. This isn’t my car! Your name’s on the title. 97. (MORE) 98. He unloads the Buicks, climbs back i

scenes.heading: EXT. SURF LODGE - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Two girls exit the hot spot, freeze when they see -- The Buick. Held together by duct tape. Margot stands outside it, smiling. She opens the back door like a chauffeur and motions inside. The girls hesitantly get in and Margot has to smash the car door shut several times to get it to close.

scenes.heading: INT. BUICK - NIGHT
scenes.actionPreview: Margot Ubers a DRUNK COUPLE making out in her back seat. Her phone BUZZES with a phone call. It’s Percy. She hits ignore.

scenes.heading: INT. PERCY’S ROOM - SAME
scenes.actionPreview: Percy sinks back into his bed. He puts headphones on, blinks away tears.

scenes.heading: INT. BUICK - ANOTHER DAY

dialogues.text: Hey, it’s me. I really miss you. I’m sorry about what I said. I was just mad about the whole betrayal thing. It’s probably my fault, I dunno.
Yo, it’s Frank. I had a lot of fun with you the other night. There’s a new restaurant I wanna take you to called--

scenes.actionPreview: Margot drives. We HEAR Percy’s voice. (MORE) 98. 99. I just wish we could talk about what happened. I’m just really confused. But sounds like maybe you don’t want to. Um... okay, I miss you. I’m around. (then) It’s Percy. CLICK. Margot hits the trash icon. We hear “MESSAGE DELETED.” Another message

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot at her laptop, a spreadsheet open. The date tells us we’re now in mid-August. The DOORBELL rings.

scenes.heading: I/E. MARGOT’S HOUSE - FRONT DOOR - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: I knew it! Alright, let’s hear it. (helping him along) “My name is Jean and I’m a registered-”
Remember when I said I worked for the government?
Worse. (hands her an envelops) IRS. And I have friends at the

scenes.actionPreview: Margot spies through the peephole, sees Jean standing there, sighs then opens the door. He’s in a suit. Beat. Margot looks at him, nervously. Suffolk County’s assessor’s office. 99. And your property taxes are going up. Way up.

scenes.heading: INT. THE LOBSTER CLAW - NIGHT

dialogues.text: That old nanny really fucked me. I was on track too. I don’t know what I’m gonna do next year.
Just sell it. Your place is way nicer than ours. You’ll never have to worry about money again.
Sara has something she wants to tell you.
We’re moving to Florida. It’s closer to Henry’s parents. It’ll be nice to have the help with the babies...
This market is on fire. Remember Doug
You’re letting these people run you out of town.
We’re choosing to move on with our lives. This is what makes sense for us.
If you say so. My mom would have wanted me to fight for my house.
Your mom wanted you to be happy.
You’ll figure it out. You always do.

scenes.actionPreview: Henry, Sara and Margot have a post-work nightcap at the bar. Who would protect you from Sara? Sara and Henry share a look. We’re selling our house. Hines? The guy with the red Miata who fucked the Spanish teacher? He’s our broker. He’s good. 101. And you don’t seem happy.

scenes.heading: INT. BOSTWICK YACHT CLUB - NIGHT

dialogues.text: Nope. And you can put this on his tab.
Guess I was hoping you’d recognize me.
Because I recognize you -- every time I run away from a mess I created. Every time I choose the easy way out and hurt somebody because of it.
No. I’m here for closure. I’ve been waiting for you to explain why you disappeared on us. Then I realized you were never going to do that. (MORE)

scenes.actionPreview: It’s happy hour. Margot, dressed elegantly, sits at the bar and looks around. Various YOUNG WOMEN with OLDER MEN populate the restaurant. A few of the older men look Margot’s way, but she avoids making any prolonged eye contact. LATER Margot sits at the bar, nursing a martini. The HANDSOME OLDER MAN

scenes.heading: EXT. CEMETERY - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot sits at her mother’s grave, lost in thought.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot pounds a FOR SALE sign into the front lawn.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT’S HOUSE - KITCHEN - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: As Doug Hines points, Margot signs escrow papers.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot removes the photos of her and her mother off the wall and puts them in bubblewrap.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT'S GARAGE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot pulls out her custom California map surfboard.

scenes.heading: EXT. BODY SHOP - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: A mechanic pulls out the Buick. It’s been completely fixed, good as new. Margot smiles, impressed by the work. She gets in, sees “Montauk Towing” directly across the street. Gary walks to his truck. We stay in the car as Margot gets out and jogs over to Gary.

scenes.heading: EXT. MONTAUK TOWING - MOMENTS LATER
scenes.actionPreview: Gary stiffens, nervously glances about at the sight of Margot. Margot says something to him. Gary nods. She keeps speaking to him. He looks down, nods some more. Margot now hugs him. He hesitates, then hugs her back. 104.

scenes.heading: INT. BEST FRIENDS - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Crispin plays with Milo, the former drug dog. Margot enters. He won’t return my calls or texts. Will you tell him I was here? Margot nods, heads to the exit and opens the door. Milo goes insane, barking into Crispin’s face.

scenes.heading: EXT. LAIRD AND ALLISON’S HOUSE - DRIVEWAY - DAY

dialogues.text: Hi, it’s Margot. Can I talk to him?
You wouldn’t believe it. He’s never home anymore. And he got his license.
What kind of car did she get?
About that. He’s still pretty upset with us. Understandable. (introspective)
A little. (then) I’m glad to hear he’s doing well.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot pulls up to the gate, hits the intercom. Oh. Okay. I understand. But why don’t you come up? DRIVEWAY - MOMENTS LATER Margot and Allison talk in the driveway. 104. 105. He’s seeing someone. (whispers) He’s not a virgin anymore. Maybe sometimes we try to do too much for him. It’s a relief.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT’S HOUSE - DAY

dialogues.text: Thanks for giving us all your furniture.
You want to take a last look? Make sure you didn’t forget anything?

scenes.actionPreview: Henry, Sara and Fern help Margot finish loading up a U-Haul trailer. Henry slides the trailer door closed. Margot looks at the house. 105. 106.

scenes.heading: INT. MARGOT'S LIVING ROOM - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot enters. Every single personal article now gone from the room. She takes a last look around, then walks out the door.

scenes.heading: EXT. MARGOT'S HOUSE - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: As Margot watches the house recede in the side view mirror.

scenes.heading: I/E. BUICK - DAY
scenes.actionPreview: Margot’s at a traffic light with the U-Haul attached. She spots Natalie crying on a bench. She’s wearing a cocktail dress and her makeup is running. Margot pulls over.

scenes.heading: EXT. STREET - BENCH -

dialogues.text: Ugh, we started hanging out a couple weeks ago. It was really fun. And... we ended up having sex. I thought he was my boyfriend. And then I found out he was talking to two other girls.
Again, this is Percy we’re talking about?
When I asked him about it he totally cut off contact. He just disappeared. He was never like this. I don’t get it.
This is my fault. I created a fuck boi.
I feel like an idiot. I got all dressed up and he completely ignored me.

scenes.actionPreview: MOMENTS LATER Margot walks up. Natalie looks up, flinches. Margot sits down beside her. It’s Percy. What happened?? Is he okay? Percy? 106. 107. Margot deflates. Just now?

scenes.heading: INT. BUICK - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: It’s up here on the right.
I’m sorry about that night at the party. I shouldn’t have yelled at you like that. (then) I was drunk.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot drives, Natalie rides shotgun. Margot pulls over and parks. Shuts the engine off. No. I wasn’t. I was just... shitty. How are you gonna get in? There’s a guest list. 107. 108. Margot reaches for Natalie’s name tag, peels it off. She flinches.

scenes.heading: INT. HAMPTONS MANSION - LATER

dialogues.text: Well I can’t wait to get eaten at
I’ve been trying to get in touch with you.

scenes.actionPreview: Hedge fund money. Margot, now with Natalie’s name tag affixed, walks through the mixer looking for Percy. Most of the middle-aged ATTENDEES are stealing glances at Margot. She sees Laird and Allison, quickly turns, walks a different direction. She spots Percy with other INCOMING FRESHMAN listening t

scenes.heading: EXT. DRIVEWAY - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.text: But I owe you something. I walked away, left you to your anger and your grief. I’m sorry, Percy. I’m so sorry.
Just get out and talk to me.
Get off the car. I don’t want anything to do with you. I don’t want to be in your shitty life.

I know my life might seem kind of depressing to you, and you know, in a lot of ways it is. But there’s some good stuff in it. Maybe I never told you about it, but there’s some really good stuff in my life. And a lot of it has to do with you. The time we spent together still matters, even if it was a lie, because you felt something honest and pure for someone else.
Fine, we’ll do it your way.

scenes.actionPreview: Percy walks to his car, Margot catches up. 108. 109. Percy walks up to a Volvo SUV, gets in. She approaches, goes for the handle. He locks it before she can open the door. He starts the car, begins to pull away. She impulsively jumps on the hood. He brakes.

scenes.heading: EXT. HAMPTONS MANSION - CATERING TRUCK AREA - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.text: The Percy I met at the beginning of the summer wouldn’t have done that to Natalie watch it--
Margot clings to the hood. A war of wills.
Fuck. This is scary. I can’t believe you did this.
You’re blocking my line of sight!
Well I’m not getting off until you promise you won’t be like me!
He drives through some beach umbrellas.
Promise you won’t be like me!

scenes.actionPreview: Caterers on their smoke break look up as Percy, with Margot on his hood, pass them. 109. 110. The other driver swerves, HONKS. Percy casually flips him off. With Margot obscuring his view, he misses the turn to the main road and blindly turns onto a sandy -- Percy swerves into a few trash cans. Garb

scenes.heading: EXT. BEACH - LATER

dialogues.text: I can’t believe you jumped on my hood.
I can’t believe you drove with me on your hood.
I can’t believe you didn’t let go.
I can’t believe you got your license.
I can’t believe you sold your house.
Actually I fixed up the Buick.
It looked busted, but it was solid inside. It just needed some love.
If you do, say hi. If you’re horny or whatever. I’m kidding.
Well, I guess this is it.

scenes.actionPreview: Margot and Percy sit on the sand. Beat. She shurgs, happy. 111. 112. Wow. That thing was busted to hell. Percy nods. They look out at the water for a beat. She stands. He stands. Margot shrugs. She laughs. Natalie approaches from the beach entrance. Percy nods. They stand for a beat... Then Margot e

scenes.heading: EXT. MONTAUK - LATER
scenes.actionPreview: The Buick passes a “Leaving Montauk” sign. Margot smiles, finally free.
